title.rendered: Your Horoscope This Spring: Renovation Edition

content.rendered:
Feeling stuck in your renovation? Look to the stars for inspiration

If your home needs a renovation, and you’re not sure where to start, why not consult the celestial bodies for some answers? Whether your sign is connected to fire, water, earth or air, each element leans toward certain colors, styles, or texture preferences. In order to prepare you for what lies ahead, we’ve compiled the best materials and techniques for each of the 12 zodiac signs. Read on to reveal what the stars say about your renovation.


A renovated apartment on the Upper East Side, Manhattan.

Aquarius (January 20-February 18)
Element: Air

You prefer to keep things open, so having fewer partitioned rooms should be the first thing on your punch list. Connecting your living spaces, like your dining and living room, is a great way to create an airy and inviting home.


A kitchen renovation in Park Slope, Brooklyn.

Pisces (February 19-March 20)
Element: Water

You’re someone with a big imagination who prefers the path of least resistance. Surrounding yourself with brightly colored and glossy materials will provide endless inspiration to keep your creativity flowing.


A bathroom renovation in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn.

Aries (March 21-April 19)
Element: Fire

You have a strong sense of self and you like to put your own stamp on things. Texture and color combined can create a bold look and let you stand out from the rest of the pack.


A kitchen renovation in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

Taurus (April 20-May 20)
Element: Earth

One might say you’re bullheaded, but that’s just another way of saying that you have strong opinions, which is a good thing when it comes to design. With an inclination towards keeping things simple, incorporating natural materials like soapstone into your home is the way to go.


A kitchen renovation in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn.

Gemini (May 21-June 20)
Element: Air

You’re someone who’s unpredictable and lives for variety, so it only makes sense that you’d want to keep things open to the winds of change. Open shelving lets you mix things up, switching out your display with each passing season or mood.


A bathroom renovation in the East Village, Manhattan.

Cancer (June 21-July 22)
Element: Water

As a careful planner who prefers to keep things consistent, you’re not one to rock the boat. Try rippled tile for an effect that suggests flowing water to help you keep your cool.


A dining area renovation in Chelsea, Manhattan.

Leo (July 23-August 22)
Element: Fire

Your sign displays a lot of confidence and pride, and you find yourself always wanting to be the center of attention. Nothing says “look at me!” like a saturated pop of color. An accent wall in Hamilton Blue can be a conversation-starter.


A nursery renovation in Chelsea, Manhattan.

Virgo (August 23-September 22)
Element: Earth

As someone who is well-organized and prefers order and balance, you feel a connection with the natural world. Custom shelving can add order and a sense of calm to any room.


A kitchen renovation in Brooklyn Heights, Brooklyn.

Libra (September 23-October 22)
Element: Air

You’re level-headed, and having your home be in harmony is very important to you. A cutout can connect your living spaces, bridging the gap between separate rooms to let them harmonize with one another.


A kitchen renovation in Midtown, Manhattan.

Scorpio (October 23-November 21)
Element: Water

Some might say you’re intense, and you often find yourself laser-focused on the next task in front of you. High-gloss and reflective finishes around your home can keep you in touch with the world around you.


A bedroom renovation in Brooklyn Heights, Brooklyn.

Sagittarius (November 22-December 21)
Element: Fire

You’re a confident, straightforward person who doesn’t need to embellish your home to feel good about yourself. Soft hues, like this wall color in Gobi Desert, can be a great way to reflect that self-assuredness.


A kitchen renovation on the Upper West Side, Manhattan.

Capricorn (December 22-January 19)
Element: Air

You’re a master of self-discipline with a penchant for realism. When it comes to designing your home, granite is a solid choice that will stand the test of time.

—

Sweeten handpicks the best general contractors to match each project’s location, budget, scope, and style. Follow the blog for renovation ideas and inspiration and when you’re ready to renovate, start your renovation on Sweeten.
